creator: elwood@agouros.de
text:
Hello, 

I am using apache 2.0.55 on hardened gentoo (SELINUX).
Among other things we use it as a reverse proxy for our Outlook Webaccess. With
OWA users can upload files. This is not working if https is used on both side
(ie the browser talks https to apache and apache https to the IIS behind it).

By writing a small sslproxy that plays man in the middle we were able to dump
the content of the session and find, that it seems to have something to do with
the mime separator. With Opera and certain IE versions we don't have a problem.
We allways have a problem with Mozilla. The only visible difference in the dump
was the length of the mime separator.

creator: rpluem@apache.org
text:
It looks like to me that you are affected by bug #37145. Please check the
patches for this bug.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 37145 ***
creator: nick@webthing.com
